queries.sql: SELECT * FROM `tbl_position` WHERE `posID` = '1'

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Inspect area and ensure inventory to be counted is clearly identified.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Check that inventory count instructions are being followed, and count is carefully carried out.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Count physical inventory and compare test counts to client’s count records to ensure the accuracy of the inventory count.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Select items from client’s count records and count physical inventory they represent, concentrating on material items (DO NOT MARK client’s copies).</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ensure all differences are resolved and consider recounts if differences have arisen.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Inspect inventory count control record to determine whether all pre-numbered inventory sheets have been accounted for including unused and spoilt sheets. Enquire into alterations / unusual items.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>If inventory sheets / cards are numerically controlled, note numbers used. In other cases, initial all inventory sheets. Consider whether there are any opportunities for insertion of non-existent inventory.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Scan or copy a sample or preferably all inventory sheets used.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Valuation</b></p>\r\n<p>Ensure inventories which appear to be excessive, long-standing, obsolete or damaged are noted.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Cut-Off</b></p> <p>Note the last number used and the next number unused of the following:</p> <ul> <li>Goods inwards notes;</li> <li>Goods outwards notes;</li> <li>Goods returned notes;</li> <li>Purchase invoices;</li> <li>Sales invoices;</li> <li>Credit notes; and</li> <li>Purchase orders.</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Ascertain how goods received / dispatched during the inventory count are dealt with.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Check that the last entries in goods received records before the inventory count commenced have been included in inventory.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Check that last dispatches prior to the inventory count have been excluded from inventory and included in sales.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Check that goods received / dispatched during the inventory count have been dealt with properly.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Check that goods moving between areas are properly controlled.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>Check inventory in transit, especially intra-group inventory, has been properly identified.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p><b>Ownership</b></p>\r\n<p>Check that inventory that does not belong to the client has been properly identified and not included in the count.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES (' <p>Summarise the adequacy and effectiveness of the client’s inventory count procedures by preparing a report in respect of each location visited, which should include the following:</p> <ul> <li>What is your opinion of the capability of the individuals responsible for organising inventory-taking?</li> <li>Were assistants properly organised and briefed?</li> <li>Were instructions adequate? (If instructions were verbal, attach a brief summary of inventory count procedures)</li> <li>Was inventory arranged so as to make inventory identification and counting efficient and straightforward?</li> <li>Were inventory counters generally familiar with the inventory that they were counting?</li> <li>What precautions were taken to prevent misdescription of the quantity units (e.g. 1 box of 10 machines recorded as 10 boxes, or imperial measurements being recorded as metric?)</li> <li>Describe the methods used to identify and quantify obsolete, surplus and damaged inventories?</li> <li>What is your opinion on the general reliability of the inventory count?</li> <li>What changes would you recommend for improving future inventory counts at this location? Have these been included in the management letter worksheet if appropriate?</li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.4.3 E2-2', '2.4.3 E2-2', '20', 'Active', '2024-04-10 10:55:56')

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>Inspect area and ensure inventory to be counted is clearly identified.</p>
    [1] => <p>Check that inventory count instructions are being followed, and count is carefully carried out.</p>
    [2] => <p>Count physical inventory and compare test counts to client’s count records to ensure the accuracy of the inventory count.</p>
    [3] => <p>Select items from client’s count records and count physical inventory they represent, concentrating on material items (DO NOT MARK client’s copies).</p>
    [4] => <p>Ensure all differences are resolved and consider recounts if differences have arisen.</p>
    [5] => <p>Inspect inventory count control record to determine whether all pre-numbered inventory sheets have been accounted for including unused and spoilt sheets.  Enquire into alterations / unusual items.</p>
    [6] => <p>If inventory sheets / cards are numerically controlled, note numbers used.  In other cases, initial all inventory sheets.  Consider whether there are any opportunities for insertion of non-existent inventory.</p>
    [7] => <p>Scan or copy a sample or preferably all inventory sheets used.</p>
    [8] => <p><b>Valuation</b></p>
<p>Ensure inventories which appear to be excessive, long-standing, obsolete or damaged are noted.</p>
    [9] => <p><b>Cut-Off</b></p>
<p>Note the last number used and the next number unused of the following:</p>
<ul>
    <li>Goods inwards notes;</li>
    <li>Goods outwards notes;</li>
    <li>Goods returned notes;</li>
    <li>Purchase invoices;</li>
    <li>Sales invoices;</li>
    <li>Credit notes; and</li>
    <li>Purchase orders.</li>
</ul>
    [10] => <p>Ascertain how goods received / dispatched during the inventory count are dealt with.</p>
    [11] => <p>Check that the last entries in goods received records before the inventory count commenced have been included in inventory.</p>
    [12] => <p>Check that last dispatches prior to the inventory count have been excluded from inventory and included in sales.</p>
    [13] => <p>Check that goods received / dispatched during the inventory count have been dealt with properly.</p>
    [14] => <p>Check that goods moving between areas are properly controlled.</p>
    [15] => <p>Check inventory in transit, especially intra-group inventory, has been properly identified.</p>
    [16] => <p><b>Ownership</b></p>
<p>Check that inventory that does not belong to the client has been properly identified and not included in the count.</p>
    [17] => 
<p>Summarise the adequacy and effectiveness of the client’s inventory count procedures by preparing a report in respect of each location visited, which should include the following:</p>
<ul>
    <li>What is your opinion of the capability of the individuals responsible for organising inventory-taking?</li>
    <li>Were assistants properly organised and briefed?</li>
    <li>Were instructions adequate? (If instructions were verbal, attach a brief summary of inventory count procedures)</li>
    <li>Was inventory arranged so as to make inventory identification and counting efficient and straightforward?</li>
    <li>Were inventory counters generally familiar with the inventory that they were counting?</li>
    <li>What precautions were taken to prevent misdescription of the quantity units (e.g. 1 box of 10 machines recorded as 10 boxes, or imperial measurements being recorded as metric?)</li>
    <li>Describe the methods used to identify and quantify obsolete, surplus and damaged inventories?</li>
    <li>What is your opinion on the general reliability of the inventory count?</li>
    <li>What changes would you recommend for improving future inventory counts at this location?  Have these been included in the management letter worksheet if appropriate?</li>
</ul>
    [18] => <p>List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)
